tit.j: 三日平氏の乱 (平安時代)
tit.e: Mikka Heishi no ran (the three-day rebellion by the Taira clan)(the Heian period)
Mikka Heishi no ran (the three-day rebellion by the Taira clan)(the Heian period)
The Three-day War by the Taira Clan (Heian period)
tit.cmt: 「○○の乱」の統一事項に基づき、The Three-day War by the Taira Clan (Heian period) としました。

sen.j: 三日平氏の乱（みっかへいしのらん）は、平安時代末期の内乱、治承・寿永の乱の戦いの一つ。
sen.e: Mikka Heishi no ran is one of the domestic conflicts in Jisho-Juei no ran in the late Heian period.
The Mikka Heishi no ran was one of the domestic conflicts which occurred in the Jisho-Juei no ran during the late Heian period.
sen.cmt: Inserted "The", changed "is" to "was", changed "in" to "which occurred in the", changed "in" to "during".
sen.e: The Three-day War by the Taira Clan was one of the domestic conflicts which occurred in the Jisho-Juei War during the late Heian period.
sen.cmt: Mikka Heishi no ran→Three-day War by the Taira Clan、Jisho-Juei no ran→Jusho-Juei Warとしました。

sen.j: 元暦元年（1184年）7月から8月にかけて、前年の平氏都落ち後に、伊賀国・伊勢国に潜伏していた平氏残党が蜂起した事件。
sen.e: This incident was an uprising from July to August in 1184 by the remnants of the Taira clan, who had been hiding in Iga Province or Ise Province since the flight of the Taira clan from Kyoto in the previous year.

The incident was an uprising from July to August of 1184 by the remnants of the Taira clan, who had been hiding in Iga Province or Ise Province since the Taira clan's flight from Kyoto in the previous year.
sen.cmt: Changed "This" to "The", changed "in" to "of", changed "the flight of the Taira clan" to "the Taira clan's flight".
sen.e: The incident was an uprising from August to September of 1184 by the remnants of the Taira clan, who had been hiding in Iga Province or Ise Province since the Taira clan's flight from Kyoto in the previous year.
sen.cmt: 旧暦→新暦に修正

sen.j: 『平家物語』で「三日平氏の乱」とされているが、本来3日間で鎮圧され「三日平氏の乱」と称されたのは、この20年後の元久元年（1204年）三日平氏の乱 (鎌倉時代)の事件であり、この1184年の平氏反乱は大規模なものであった。
sen.e: This was referred to as 'Mikka Heishi no ran' in Heike Monogatari (The tale of the Heike), but it was the incident of Mikka Heishi no ran (Kamakura period) in 1204, 20 years after this that was really suppressed in 3 days and was originally called 'Mikka Heishi no ran', and this rebellion by the Taira clan in 1184 was a major one.

It was referred to as the 'Mikka Heishi no ran' in Heike Monogatari (The tale of the Heike), but it was the incident of Mikka Heishi no ran (Kamakura period) in 1204, 20 years later, which was really suppressed in 3 days and was originally called 'Mikka Heishi no ran', while this rebellion by the Taira clan in 1184 was a major one.
sen.cmt: Changed "This" to "It", inserted "the", inserted comma after "later", changed "that" to "which", changed "and" to "while".
sen.e: It was referred to as the 'Three-day War by the Taira Clan' in "Heike Monogatari" (The tale of the Heike), but it was the incident of Three-day War by the Taira Clan (Kamakura period) in 1204, 20 years later, which was really suppressed in three days and was originally called 'Three-day War by the Taira Clan,' while this rebellion by the Taira clan in 1184 was a major one.
sen.cmt: Three-day War by the Taira Clanとし、本文表記に合わせHeike Monogatariにクォーテーション追加、"3"をスペルアウト

sen.j: 寿永2年（1183年）7月の平氏西走後も、その本拠であった伊賀・伊勢両国には平氏家人が播居しており、元暦元年（1184年）3月に大内惟義が伊賀の守護に補任され、武蔵国の御家人大井実春が平家与党討伐のため伊勢に派遣される。
sen.e: Even after the Taira clan escaped to Saigoku (western part of Japan) in July 1183, house men of the Taira clan lived in wide areas of both Iga and Ise Province, which had been their home ground, so Koreyoshi OUCHI was assigned as Ise shugo (military governor of Ise) and Saneharu OI, a vassal in Musashi Province, was dispatched to Ise to subdue the Taira clan and their retainers there.
sen.cmt: 定訳不明 「播居する」の日本語の意味自体不明で、live in wide areas にしました。 「補任する」→assign
sen.e: Even after the Taira clan escaped to Saigoku (the western part of Japan) in July 1183, men of the Taira clan lived over wide areas of both Iga and Ise Provinces, which had been their home territory, so Koreyoshi OUCHI was assigned as Ise shugo (military governor of Ise) and Saneharu OI, a vassal in Musashi Province, was dispatched to Ise to subdue the Taira clan and their retainers there.
sen.cmt: Inserted "the", deleted "house", inserted "s" at end of "Province", changed "home ground" to "home territory", deleted extra space before "was".
sen.e: Even after the Taira clan escaped to Saigoku (the western part of Japan) in July 1183, men of the Taira clan lived over wide areas of both Iga and Ise Provinces, which had been their home territory, so Koreyoshi OUCHI was assigned as Ise shugo (military governor of Ise) and Saneharu OI, a vassal in Musashi Province, was dispatched to Ise to subdue the Taira clan and their retainers there in April 1184.
sen.cmt: 元暦元年（1184年）3月→訳漏れのため、訳出しました。

sen.j: 7月7日辰の刻（午後8時頃）に平家継を大将軍とする反乱が勃発し、襲撃を受けた惟義の郎従が多数殺害された。
sen.e: When a rebellion with TAIRA no Ietsugu as the great general broke out around 8 in the evening of August 21, 1184, many of Koreyoshi's retainers were killed in the attack.
When a rebellion headed by TAIRA no Ietsugu broke out around 8:00 PM of August 21, 1184, many of Koreyoshi's retainers were killed in the attack.
sen.cmt: Changed "with TAIRA (…) as the great general" to "headed by TAIRA", changed "8 in the evening" to "8:00 PM".
sen.e: When a rebellion headed by TAIRA no Ietsugu broke out around 8:00 PM of August 21, 1184, many of Koreyoshi's retainers were killed in the attack.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 時を同じくして伊勢でも平信兼以下が鈴鹿山を切り塞いで謀反を起こし、院中は例えようもないほど動揺したという（『玉葉』7月8日条）。
sen.e: At the same time, also in Ise TAIRA no Nobukane and his followers blocked off Mt. Suzuka by cutting trees there and rose in revolt, which was said to upset the whole In. ("Gyokuyo" the article of August 22, 1184)

At the same time, also in Ise, TAIRA no Nobukane and his followers blocked off Mt. Suzuka by cutting down trees and rose in revolt, which was said to upset the whole In. ("Gyokuyo" the article of August 22, 1184)
sen.cmt: Inserted comma after "Ise", inserted "down", removed "there".
sen.e: At the same time, also in Ise, TAIRA no Nobukane and his followers blocked off Mt. Suzuka by cutting down trees and rose in revolt, which was said to upset the whole In ("Gyokuyo" (The Diary of Kanezane KUJO) the article of August 22, 1184).
sen.cmt: ピリオドの位置を移動、"Gyokuyo"の補足追加

sen.j: 19日には近江国大原荘で鎌倉軍（官軍）と平氏残党が合戦となる。
sen.e: Kamakura army (government army) had a war with remnants of the Taira clan in Ohara-no-sho, Omi Province on September 2.
The Kamakura army (government army) fought remnants of the Taira clan in Ohara-no-sho, Omi Province, on September 2.
sen.cmt: Inserted "The", changed "had a war with" to "fought", inserted comma after "Province".
sen.e: The Kamakura army (government army) fought remnants of the Taira clan in Ohara no sho, Omi Province, on September 2.
sen.cmt: Ohara-no-shoのハイフン消去

sen.j: 家継が討ち取られて梟首され、侍大将の富田家助・家能・家清入道らが討ち取られた。
sen.e: Ietsugu was defeated and his head was put on public display while TOMITA no Iesuke, Ieyoshi and Iekiyo Nyudo, who were Samurai Daishos (commander of warriors), were defeated and killed.
sen.cmt: 定訳不明 「梟首する」、head is put on public displayとしました。
sen.e: Ietsugu was defeated and his head put on public display, while TOMITA no Iesuke, Ieyoshi and Iekiyo Nyudo, who were Samurai Daishos (commander of warriors), were defeated and killed.
sen.cmt: Deleted "was", inserted comma after "display".
sen.e: Ietsugu was defeated and his head put on public display, while TOMITA no Iesuke, Ieyoshi and Iekiyo Nyudo, who were Samurai Daishos (commander of warriors), were defeated and killed.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 平信兼・藤原忠清は行方をくらませた。
sen.e: TAIRA no Nobukane and FUJIWARA no Tadakiyo made a bolt and disappeared.
TAIRA no Nobukane and FUJIWARA no Tadakiyo disappeared, covering their tracks.
sen.cmt: Changed "made a bolt and disappeared" to "disappeared, covering their tracks".
sen.e: TAIRA no Nobukane and FUJIWARA no Tadakiyo disappeared, covering their tracks.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 反乱はほぼ鎮圧されたものの、源氏方も老将佐々木秀義が討ち死にし、死者数百騎に及ぶ大きな損害を受けた。
sen.e: Although the rebellion was almost subdued, Hideyoshi SASAKI, an old general, died in the battle and the part of the Minamoto clan also suffered enormous damage of as many as several hundred horsemen's deaths.

Although the rebellion was all but subdued, the Minamoto clan also suffered enormous damages, including the deaths in battle of Hideyoshi SASAKI, an old general, and as many as several hundred horsemen.
sen.cmt: Changed "almost" to "all but", rewrote second half of sentence.
sen.e: Although the rebellion was all but subdued, the Minamoto clan also suffered enormous damages, including the deaths in battle of Hideyoshi SASAKI, an old general, and as many as several hundred horsemen.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 8月3日、事態を重く見た源頼朝は、蜂起した平氏勢力の中の最有力人物である平信兼の捜索を源義経に命じる。
sen.e: On September 16, MINAMOTO no Yoritomo took the matter seriously and ordered MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune to search out TAIRA no Nobukane, who was the dominant figure of the Taira clan.
On September 16, taking the matter seriously, MINAMOTO no Yoritomo ordered MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune to find TAIRA no Nobukane, who was the dominant figure of the Taira clan.
sen.cmt: Inserted "taking the matter seriously,", deleted "took the matter seriously and", changed "search out" to "find".
sen.e: On September 16, taking the matter seriously, MINAMOTO no Yoritomo ordered MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune to find TAIRA no Nobukane, who was the dominant figure of the Taira clan.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 10日、信兼の3人の子息、平兼衡・平信衡・平兼時が京の義経邸に呼び出され、斬殺、自害へ追い込まれている。
sen.e: On September 23, Nobukane's three sons, TAIRA no Kanehira, TAIRA no Nobuhira and TAIRA no Kanetoki were summoned to Yoshitsune's residence in Kyoto and were put to the sword or compelled to suicide.

On September 23, Nobukane's three sons, TAIRA no Kanehira, TAIRA no Nobuhira and TAIRA no Kanetoki, were summoned to Yoshitsune's residence in Kyoto and were put to the sword or forced to commit suicide.
sen.cmt: Inserted comma, changed "compelled to" to "forced to commit".
sen.e: On September 23, Nobukane's three sons, TAIRA no Kanehira, TAIRA no Nobuhira and TAIRA no Kanetoki, were summoned to Yoshitsune's residence in Kyoto and were put to the sword or forced to commit suicide.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 義経はその2日後に信兼討伐に出撃した（『山槐記』8月10日条）。
sen.e: Two days after that, Yoshitsune sortied to put down Nobukane. ("Sankaiki" the article of September 23).
Two days after that, Yoshitsune sortied to put down Nobukane. ("Sankaiki" the article of September 23).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Two days after that, Yoshitsune sortied to put down Nobukane ("Sankaiki" (The Diary by Tadachika NAKAYAMA) the article of September 23).
sen.cmt: 余分なピリオドを削除、"Sankaiki"の補足追加

sen.j: その後の合戦の経過について貴族の日記による記録はないが、『源平盛衰記』によると、伊勢国滝野の城に立てこもる100騎ほどの信兼軍が激戦の末、討ち取られたという。
sen.e: There is no record in the diaries written by nobles about the subsequent course of the battle, but according to "Genpei Seisui ki" (Rise and Fall of the Minamoto and the Taira clans), about 100 horsemen were defeated and killed after the fierce battle.

There is no record in the diaries written by nobles about the subsequent course of the battle, but according to "Genpei Seisui ki" (Rise and Fall of the Minamoto and the Taira clans), after a fierce battle, about 100 horsemen were defeated and killed.
sen.cmt: Changed "about 100 horsemen were defeated and killed after the fierce battle" to "after a fierce battle, about 100 horsement were defeated and killed".
sen.e: There is no record in the diaries written by nobles about the subsequent course of the battle, but according to "Genpei Seisui Ki" (Rise and Fall of the Minamoto and the Taira clans), after a fierce battle, about 100 horsemen on the Nobukane side that holed up in the castle of Takino, Ise Province were defeated and killed.
sen.cmt: 余分なスペース消去、"Genpei Seisui Ki"としました。「伊勢国滝野の城に立てこもる」「信兼軍」→訳漏れのため訳出しました。

sen.j: この平信兼追討の最中の8月6日、義経は後白河天皇より左衛門少尉、検非違使に任じられた。
sen.e: Yoshitsune was appointed as Jr. Lieutenant of the Left Division of Outer Palace Guards, police and judicial chief by the Emperor Goshirakawa on September 19 when he was in the midst of putting down TAIRA no Nobukane.

Yoshitsune was appointed as Jr. Lieutenant of the Left Division of Outer Palace Guards, police and judicial chief by the Emperor Goshirakawa on September 19, while he was in the midst of putting down TAIRA no Nobukane.
sen.cmt: Changed "when" to "while".
sen.e: Yoshitsune was appointed as Saemon no shojo (Junior Lieutenant of the Left Division of Outer Palace Guards), Kebiishi (officials with judicial and police powers) by the Cloistered Emperor Goshirakawa on September 19, while he was in the midst of putting down TAIRA no Nobukane.
sen.cmt: 「左衛門少尉」「検非違使」の表記を修正、Emperor Goshirakawa→Cloistered Emperor Goshirakawaに修正

sen.j: 8月26日、鎌倉に義経から信兼の子息3人を宿所に呼び寄せて誅した事、信兼が出羽国国司を解官されたとの報告が届き、9月9日、信兼以下平氏家人の京都における所有地を、義経の支配とするよう頼朝から書状が出された（『吾妻鏡』）。
sen.e: The report from Yoshitsune that he summoned Nobukane's three sons to his accommodation and killed them and that Nobukane was dismissed from Dewa no kuni Kokushi (the governor of Dewa Province) came to Kamakura on October 9, and on October 22 a letter was sent out from Yoritomoto to put the land of Nobukane and house men of the Taira clan in Kyoto under Yoshitsune's control. ("Azuma Kagami")(The Mirror of the East).

A report from Yoshitsune stating that he had summoned Nobukane's three sons to his accommodation and killed them and that Nobukane had been dismissed from Dewa no kuni Kokushi (the governor of Dewa Province) reached Kamakura on October 9, and on October 22 a letter was sent out from Yoritomoto to put the land of Nobukane and the men of the Taira clan in Kyoto under Yoshitsune's control ("Azuma Kagami")(The Mirror of the East).
sen.cmt: Changed "The" to "A", inserted "stating", inserted "had", changed "was" to "had been", changed "came to" to "reached", deleted "house", deleted period after "control".
sen.e: A report from Yoshitsune stating that he had summoned Nobukane's three sons to his accommodation and killed them and that Nobukane had been dismissed from Dewa no kuni Kokushi (the governor of Dewa Province) reached Kamakura on October 9, and on October 22 a letter was sent out from Yoritomoto to put the land of Nobukane and the men of the Taira clan in Kyoto under Yoshitsune's control ("Azuma Kagami" (The Mirror of the East)).
sen.cmt: カッコ修正

sen.j: 藤原忠清は翌元暦2年（1185年）まで潜伏を続けて都を脅かした。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Tadakiyo kept himself hidden and threatened the capital until the following year, 1185.
FUJIWARA no Tadakiyo remained in hiding and continued to threaten the capital until the following year, 1185.
sen.cmt: Changed "kept himself hidden" to "remained in hiding", changed "threatened" to "continued to threaten".
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Tadakiyo remained in hiding and continued to threaten the capital until the following year, 1185.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 一ノ谷の戦い以降、源範頼以下主な鎌倉武士は帰東しており、またこの反乱の最中の8月8日に、範頼は平氏追討のために鎌倉を出立し、9月1日に京から西海へ向かっている。
sen.e: After the Battle of Ichinotani MINAMOTO no Noriyori and main Kamakura warriors had gone back to east, but again on September 21, in the midst of this rebellion, Noriyori left Kamakura and headed from Kyoto for Saikai (provinces on the western seacoast) to search out and kill the Taira clan on October 22.

After the Battle of Ichinotani, MINAMOTO no Noriyori and the main body of the Kamakura warriors had returned to the East, but on September 21, in the midst of this rebellion, Noriyori again left Kamakura and, on October 22, headed from Kyoto for Saikai (the provinces on the western seacoast) to search out and kill the Taira clan.
sen.cmt: Changed "main" to "the main body of the", changed "had gone back" to "had returned", capitalized "East", moved "again" from after "but" to after "Noriyori", moved "on October 22" from end of sentence to after "Kamakura and,".
sen.e: After the Battle of Ichinotani, MINAMOTO no Noriyori and the main body of the Kamakura warriors had returned to the East, but on September 21, in the midst of this rebellion, Noriyori again left Kamakura and, on October 22, headed from Kyoto for Saikai (the provinces on the western seacoast) to search out and kill the Taira clan.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 平氏残党に対する都の不安は大きく、後白河院は治安維持のために翌年正月の義経の屋島出撃を引き留めており、義経の検非違使・左衛門尉任官は、このような情勢の不安による人事であった。
sen.e: The remnants of the Taira clan made the capital so fearful that Goshirakawain held back Yoshitsune's sortie to Yashima in January of the following year to maintain security, and this perturbed situation caused the appointment of Yoshitsune to Jr. Lieutenant of the Left Division of Outer Palace Guards, police and judicial chief.

The remnants of the Taira clan made the capital so fearful that Goshirakawain prevented Yoshitsune's sortie to Yashima in January of the following year to maintain security, and this perturbed situation was what caused the appointment of Yoshitsune to Jr. Lieutenant of the Left Division of Outer Palace Guards, police and judicial chief.
sen.cmt: Changed "held back" to "prevented", inserted "was what".
sen.e: The remnants of the Taira clan made the capital so fearful that Goshirakawain prevented Yoshitsune's sortie to Yashima in January of the following year to maintain security, and this perturbed situation was what caused the appointment of Yoshitsune to Kebiishi and Saemon no jo (Lieutenant of the Left Division of Outer Palace Guards).
sen.cmt: 「左衛門尉」「検非違使」の表記を修正、訳文の順序を入れ替え

sen.j: 近年の研究では、義経が平氏追討から外されたのは、後年の編纂書『吾妻鏡』が記すような無断任官による頼朝の怒りのためではなく、京都の治安維持に義経が必要であり、法皇や貴族たちの強い反対があったためと考えられている。
sen.e: According to the recent studies, it is thought that Yoshitsune was dismissed from the army to search out and kill the Taira clan not because Yoritomo resented the appointment of Yoshitsune without his permission as described in "Azuma Kagami", which was compiled in later years, but because Yoshitsune was needed to maintain the security of Kyoto and the Cloistered Emperor and nobles were strongly against it.

According to recent studies, it is thought that Yoshitsune was dismissed from the army to search out and kill the Taira clan not because Yoritomo resented the appointment of Yoshitsune without his permission (as described in "Azuma Kagami", which was compiled in later years), but because Yoshitsune was needed to maintain the security of Kyoto and the Cloistered Emperor and nobles were strongly against it.
sen.cmt: Deleted "the".
sen.e: According to recent studies, it is thought that Yoshitsune was dismissed from the army to search out and kill the Taira clan not because Yoritomo resented the appointment of Yoshitsune without his permission (as described in "Azuma Kagami," which was compiled in later years), but because Yoshitsune was needed to maintain the security of Kyoto and the Cloistered Emperor and nobles were strongly against it.
sen.cmt: カンマの位置を移動、余分なスペース消去

sen.j: なお、平信兼と平家継は源義仲打倒の立場から、義経の入京に協力した京武者たちであった。
sen.e: In addition, TAIRA no Nobukane and TAIRA no Ietsugu were the samurai in the imperial capital who had collaborated for Yoshitsune to enter the capital for the purpose of defeating MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka.

In addition, TAIRA no Nobukane and TAIRA no Ietsugu were samurai in the imperial capital who had collaborated to aid Yoshitsune's entrance to the capital for the purpose of defeating MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka.
sen.cmt: Deleted "the", changed "for" to "to aid", changed "Yoshitsune to enter the capital" to "Yoshitsune's entrance to the capital".
sen.e: In addition, TAIRA no Nobukane and TAIRA no Ietsugu were samurai in the imperial capital who had collaborated to aid Yoshitsune's entrance to the capital for the purpose of defeating MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 『吾妻鏡』では信兼の息子たちが事件の張本であったとするが、彼らは義経の屋敷に出向いている事から、反乱と深い関わりは持っていなかったと見られる。
sen.e: According to "Azuma Kagami" Nobukane's sons were responsible for the incident, but the fact that they went to Yoshitsune's residence shows they seems not to have been deeply involved in the rebellion.

According to "Azuma Kagami", Nobukane's sons were responsible for the incident, but from the fact that they went to Yoshitsune's residence, they seem not to have been deeply involved in the rebellion.
sen.cmt: Inserted comma, inserted "from", deleted "shows", removed "s" from "seems".
sen.e: According to "Azuma Kagami," Nobukane's sons were responsible for the incident, but from the fact that they went to Yoshitsune's residence, they seem not to have been deeply involved in the rebellion.
sen.cmt: カンマの位置を移動

sen.j: 信兼追討の背景には、独立性の強い京武者の排除、従属させようとする頼朝の方針があったと考えられる。
sen.e: It is thought that Yoritomo's policy of excluding or subordinating the independent samurai in the imperial capital was the underlying reason for searching out and killing Nobukane.
It is thought that Yoritomo's policy of excluding or subordinating the independent samurai in the imperial capital was the reason which underlay the hunt for Nobukane.
sen.cmt: Changed "the underlying reason for searching out and killing Nobukane" to "the reason which underlay the hunt for Nobukane".
sen.e: It is thought that Yoritomo's policy of excluding or subordinating the independent samurai in the imperial capital was the reason which underlay the hunt for Nobukane.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
